resources.string: Once you save some fractals of your own, you\'ll see them here!
If you upgrade to the pro version, you can save your own fractals here!
This fractal already exists. Overwrite it?
You must enter a name for this fractal to save it!
Tell all your friends about it
We hope it\'s worth five stars.
Have a suggestion, found a bug, or just want to say thanks? Write me!
"Thanks for using this app!\nI'm really just one guy who likes to make quality apps and games for Android. Please check out my other apps below!"
Other Apps and Games by Resonos
"Turn your camera or any picture into a smoothly animating and endlessly mesmerizing kaleidoscope!"
"A multiplayer online games community: play Chess, Checkers, Reversi, and Connect Four against players around the world. Complete with a social networking platform."
"Blast a platform of spinning jewels in outer space. How long can you survive the onslaught?"
"Shoot hoops in real time against players everywhere and try to top the scores. A new round starts every two minutes!"

"Version 2.0 - April 14, 2012|- Complete app rewrite with modern ICS-style Action Bar!
- Feature: tutorial
- Feature: Visible rendering progress
- Feature / Bugfix: Panning and zooming now available in editor and vastly improved in renderer
- Slightly modified editing system with hints added|Version 1.01 - January 21, 2011|- Reduced memory usage|Version 1.0 - January 19, 2011|- Initial release"

"INTERNET|- Allows access to the internet.\n- Used to check for updates and report errors to the developer|WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE|- Used to save fractal pictures to the SD card.|SET_WALLPAPER|- Used to set the wallpaper to fractal images|ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE|- Used to determine whether or not the device currently has internet access"

Thank you for using a Resonos mobile application!
Check out this awesome app called Fractal Designer! Get it from Google Play Market: %1$s
"Check out this cool picture I made using Fractal Designer for Android! Get Fractal Designer at https://market.android.com/details?id=com.resonos.apps.fractal.ifs"
"This fractal is too complex for your poor smartphone to render! Try using less transformations or a color scheme with one or few gradients."
Your poor smartphone ran out of memory! Please try restarting the game, or contact us if you see this message frequently.
Your version of this app is out of date! Please update by going to the Android Market.
Upgrade to Fractal Designer Pro to remove ads like this!
"You seem to have used Fractal Designer a number of times, we hope because you like it! If you feel the game deserves it, we'd appreciate a positive review in the Android Market. Thanks!"

"Thank you for using the free version of Fractal Designer. We'd appreciate your support by buying the full version for only $1.99.\nThe best part is that the upgrade just unlocks features in this app—no need to uninstall any old version."
- Save fractals you create in the Gallery\n- Design your own color schemes using a fully-featured gradient editor
You must have the pro version of Fractal Designer to save your own fractals. Check out the upgrade page!
You must have the pro version of Fractal Designer to edit color schemes. Check out the upgrade page!
You must have the pro version of Fractal Designer to design your own color schemes. Check out the upgrade page!
Your content will arrive in a moment, but by purchasing the ad-free upgrade, this brief pause before using Fractal Designer will be removed. Check it out on the upgrade page!
Your content will arrive in a moment, but by purchasing the ad-free upgrade, this brief pause before using Fractal Designer will be removed. Check it out on the upgrade page!

Welcome to Version 2.0! Along with a few bugfixes, you can now use your phone\'s orientation sensors to move the kaleidoscope. Additionally, phones with proper touchscreens can now use a rotate gesture.
"Cannot access SD Card! It is either mounted or not inserted."
"Image saved, check your phone's media gallery!"
Welcome to the Fractal Designer tutorial! Just touch the screen anywhere to proceed, or hit your back button to leave the tutorial at any time.
If you would like to unlock the full features of the app, check out the Upgrade section.
Thank you for upgrading Fractal Designer! Your support is appreciated.
The Editor is where all of the magic happens—in it you can create infinite varieties of fractals.
Here we are in the editor, on an empty white board with a box. Nothing is here—yet. We can pan around by dragging one finger, and zoom in and out using a two-finger pinch gesture. Try it out!
Fractals are composed of boxes, which you can add using this button.

A box is just that—a square that you can move (using the blue circle), rotate (using the pink circle), resize (using the green circle), and skew (using the two red circles). Try it on your own to get comfortable.
Now let\'s create a fractal. Watch the assembly steps…
Here we\'ve moved the first box into place
…and moved it into place. Look at that—already, we have a fractal! Now watch something really cool.
See just how easy it is to create endless fractals? Now how the boxes create these beautiful fractals is what you\'ll have to figure out on your own.
You can open and save fractals using the Action Bar buttons above.
And in the menu you can enable or disable a grid, and if you ever lose some boxes you had onscreen, restore them.
This editor is great, but the fractal looks kind of ugly still…

Rendering takes a short amount of time, indicated by the progress in the action bar. Like the editor, you can pan and zoom with your fingers, but the fractal will need to rerender. The farther you zoom in, the longer it will take.
The quality button opens up two sliders. The detail level controls how detailed the render will be, but also how long it will take.
The color steps slider indicates how fast colors change. When you render things on your own, try playing with them to find the best look for your fractal.
You can change the color scheme as well. There are a variety of defaults for you to explore later. By upgrading, you will be able to design your own.
You can change the color scheme as well. There are a variety of defaults for you to explore later. You can also design your own.
Using the action bar, you can save an image, share the fractal, or set it as your wallpaper.
Let\'s go back home now to see the Gallery.
The Gallery stores any fractals that you wish to save, as well as a variety of samples to get you started.
Here you can see all of the fractals, organized into categories. You can be drag your screen left or right to browse. Fractals saved by the user are in the rightmost category.
This ends your tutorial. Enjoy using Fractal Designer! Please consider purchasing the full version!
This ends your tutorial. Enjoy using Fractal Designer! Thank you for upgrading!
